newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Hyundai Sec shrs up on trust firm report.
newsitem.headline: Hyundai Sec shrs up on trust firm report.

text.p: Shares of Hyundai Securities Co rose 1,000 won to their daily limit of 17,700 won in Monday morning on a news report that the government was considering allowing Hyundai Group to take a controlling stake in a local investment trust firm, brokers said.
Brokers said investors continued buying the stock despite a denial by a senior official at the finance ministry of the Chosun Ilbo report.

The newspaper report on Monday quoted unnamed government sources as saying the ministry was considering allowing Hyundai to take a controlling stake in Seoul-based Citizens Investment Trust Management Co.
Earlier bids by Hyundai to accumulate shares in Citizens had been aborted by a strong opposition by the government.
Analysts say Hyundai Group, South Korea's largest conglomerate in terms of assets, wants to take over the trust firm in a bid to strengthen its financial business sector.
Hyundai Group officials could not be immediately reached for comment on the report. --Seoul Newsroom (822) 727 5646
